N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4214.1 - Statement of purpose

State Regulations

The Prompt Payment Law, enacted by the New York State

Legislature, requires State public authorities and public benefit corporations
to pay their bills within specific time periods. The law also requires interest
to be paid to vendors for unjustified late payments. This policy statement is
adopted pursuant to subdivisions 2 and 3(a) of section
2880
of
the Public Authorities Law of the State of New York, and is described
below. Notes
